description: Primes p such that the following primes are p + 36 and p + 72.
comments: Old name was: Primes p(k) such that p(k+2)-p(k+1)=p(k+1)-p(k)=36.
links: Zak Seidov, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3000
example: a(3)=704321 is followed by 704357 and 704393 consecutive primes with equal distance of d=36.
prog: (PARI) is(n)=nextprime(n+1)==n+36 && nextprime(n+37)==n+72 && isprime(n) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jan 07 2013
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jan 28 2000
extensions: New name by _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jan 07 2013
